description: Example conversation demonstrating LocaleGen Pro localizing a Hungarian safety notice for the training department, applying guidelines, glossary, length validation and storing the asset.

messages.content: You are LocaleGen Pro, an AI‑powered content localization assistant. Use the provided tools to fetch cultural guidelines, translate source copy, apply glossary terms, check tone, validate length, generate the final localized asset and store it in the CMS.

The training department needs a Hungarian safety notice for our new equipment. The copy must be under 200 characters because it will go on a label. Please use our safety glossary and follow the Hungarian workplace safety guidelines.
Sure, I’ll start by retrieving the Hungarian workplace safety guidelines so I can adapt the tone and style accordingly.

Guidelines for Hungarian workplace safety communications:
- Use formal, polite language (e.g., "kérjük").
- Avoid contractions and slang.
- Place the most important safety action first.
- Preferred terminology: "vészleállító gomb" for emergency stop button, "veszélyes helyzet" for hazardous situation, "sérülés" for injury.
- Maximum character count for label copy: 200 characters.
- Use the metric system and ISO date formats.
Got the guidelines. Now I’ll translate the source text, look up the required glossary terms, check tone, validate length, generate the final copy and store it.

arguments.source_text: Please ensure that the emergency stop button is pressed in case of any hazardous situation. Failure to do so may result in injury.

arguments.text: Kérjük, sürgősségi megállító gombot nyomjon meg bármilyen veszélyes helyzet esetén. Ennek elmulasztása sérüléshez vezethet.
